greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle related to the o.g.f.s. of the right-hand columns of A028421 (E(x,m=2,n)).
comment: The asymptotic expansions of the higher-order exponential integral E(x,m=2,n) lead to triangle A028421, see A163931 for information on E(x,m,n). The o.g.f.s. of the right-hand columns of triangle A028421 have a nice structure: gf(p) = W2(z,p)/(1-z)^(2*p) with p = 1 for the first right-hand column, p = 2 for the second right-hand column, etc. The coefficients of the W2(z,p) polynomials lead to the triangle given above, n >= 1 and 1 <= m <= n. The row sums of this triangle lead to A001147 (minus a(0)), see A163936 for more information.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
example: The first few W2(z,p) polynomials are
maple: with(combinat): a := proc(n, m): add((-1)^(n+k+1)*((m-k)/1!)*binomial(2*n, k)*stirling1(m+n-k-1, m-k), k=0..m-1) end: seq(seq(a(n, m), m=1..n), n=1..9);  # _Johannes W. Meijer_, revised Nov 27 2012
mathematica: Table[Sum[(-1)^(n + k + 1)*((m - k)/1!)*Binomial[2*n, k]*StirlingS1[m + n - k - 1, m - k], {k, 0, m - 1}], {n, 1, 10}, {m, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 13 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1,10, for(m=1,n, print1(sum(k=0,m-1, (-1)^(n+k+1)*((m-k)/1!)*binomial(2*n,k) *stirling1(m+n-k-1,m-k)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 13 2017
xref: A000142, 2*A001705, are the first two left hand columns.
A000027 is the first right hand column.
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Aug 13 2009
